senses.de: A plan of things to be done and when they are to be done
senses.ex: I have a busy schedule today.

Tips.title: Time Management
Tips.description: Used to describe detailed plans for time allocation.
Tips.example: I need to follow my study schedule strictly to cover all topics.

Tips.title: Fixed Plans
Tips.description: Denotes activities with determined dates or times, not easily changed.
Tips.example: Our family vacation is on the schedule for July.

senses.de: To arrange for something to happen at a particular time
senses.ex: They scheduled a meeting for next week.

Tips.title: Future Action
Tips.description: Implies a planned future activity, often needing confirmation from others.
Tips.example: Can we schedule the job interview for Thursday?

Tips.title: Commitment Indicator
Tips.description: Suggests formal agreement about a future event between parties.
Tips.example: The manager scheduled a follow-up meeting with the client.

senses.de: A list showing when events are planned to happen, especially in a public place
senses.ex: The schedule for the conference is available online.

Tips.title: Public Information
Tips.description: Refers to a timetable accessible to the public, like in events or transport.
Tips.example: You'll find the train schedule posted at the station.

Tips.title: Sequence of Events
Tips.description: Implies a series of planned events, often arranged in order of occurrence.
Tips.example: The festival's schedule lists all the bands playing this weekend.

senses.de: In legal terms, a list of matters to be heard in court
senses.ex: The court schedule is posted every Monday.

Tips.title: Legal Document
Tips.description: A formal record in legal contexts, reflecting court activities.
Tips.example: According to the schedule, the hearing is at 10 am.

Tips.title: Court Procedures
Tips.description: Shows the order of cases a court will address on a given day or period.
Tips.example: The lawyer checked the court's schedule to prepare for his case.

senses.de: In computing, a sequence of tasks to be processed by a computer
senses.ex: You can alter the schedule in the task manager.

Tips.title: Task Order
Tips.description: Indicates the sequence or timing for tasks that a computer will execute.
Tips.example: The server's maintenance schedule includes nightly backups.

senses.de: To arrange for a task to be done automatically by a computer at a particular time
senses.ex: You can schedule a virus scan to run every week.

Tips.title: Automation
Tips.description: Refers to setting up computer tasks to occur without further human input.
Tips.example: We've scheduled the system to update automatically at midnight.

Agenda.wordDefinition:
Agenda refers to a list of items or topics that need to be discussed or accomplished during a meeting, conference, or event.

Schedule refers to a timeline of events or appointments that have been planned, with specific times and dates. It is a more structured plan than an agenda.

An agenda is a list of things that need to be talked about, while a schedule is a planned timeline of events. An agenda is applicable in meetings or personal planning, while a schedule is applicable in events or appointments.

Calendar.wordDefinition:
A calendar is a chart or list that shows the dates of a specific period, like a month, a year, or even years from the present to the future or past.

A calendar is a general overview of dates and events, while a schedule is a detailed plan of specific tasks and times. Calendars are useful for keeping track of important dates and planning events, while schedules are useful for managing time and ensuring that tasks are completed in a timely manner.

Itinerary.wordDefinition:
Itinerary generally refers to a planned route or journey, especially one that includes specific destinations or activities.

It is usually used when talking about travel plans or trips. For example, your itinerary for a trip to Europe might include stops in Paris, Amsterdam, and Berlin.

Itinerary refers to a planned route or journey, while schedule refers to a plan or timetable for when certain events will happen.

Plan.wordDefinition:
A plan is a general idea or strategy about what you want to do or achieve. It's like a roadmap that guides you towards your goal. You can plan for a trip or a project.

A schedule is a more detailed plan that includes specific dates, times, and tasks that need to be completed. It's like a timetable that outlines the steps you need to take to achieve your goal.

A plan is the overall strategy, and a schedule is the specific timeline for executing that strategy.

Programme.wordDefinition:
A program is a written or spoken plan for an event, such as a concert or a meeting. It outlines the events or activities that are scheduled to take place.

A program is more specific to an event, such as a graduation ceremony, and outlines what will happen at the event.

A schedule is more general and organizes time, such as a TV schedule or a train schedule. Both words can be used interchangeably depending on the context, but generally, program is used for events and schedule is used for organizing time.

Roster.wordDefinition:
A roster is a list of people or groups, while a schedule is a list of events or tasks.

For example, a roster might be used in a sports team to list the players' names and positions, while a schedule would list the dates and times of their games.

In a workplace, a roster would list the employees' names and their assigned shifts, while a schedule might outline deadlines or meetings.

A roster is for organizing people, and a schedule is for organizing events or tasks.

Timetable.wordDefinition:
The words schedule and timetable both refer to a plan of activities or events, but there is a slight difference in their usage.

Timetable typically refers to a more fixed plan of activities that are less likely to change, such as a bus timetable or a school timetable.

Timetables usually have set times and dates that are not subject to change unless there is a major disruption.

Schedule is more flexible and adaptable, while timetable is more fixed and reliable. Both words are used in various contexts, but knowing the subtle difference in their usage can help communicate more accurately.

quotes.Text: Jumping into something new is always challenging with the schedule and the routine and when you can train, and fit that into your life that you already have right now.
quotes.Title: American Wrestler
quotes.Name: Jake Hager

quotes.Text: Don't worry if you don't complete everything on the schedule. At least you will have completed the most important projects before getting to the less important ones.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Ivy Lee

quotes.Text: It's my responsibility to make the movie work with the schedule and money we have. It's my job to get the best movie we can do in the time we have.
quotes.Title: American Producer
quotes.Name: George Tillman, Jr.

quotes.Text: Although I have a busy work schedule, I make sure I spend time with my family and create a balance between my work and family life.
quotes.Title: Indian Producer
quotes.Name: Gauri Khan

quotes.Text: I live - I live a highly scheduled life. There's absolutely no time wasted. I'm very focused. And I have a great assistant.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Madonna Ciccone

quotes.Text: I always found the film world unpleasant. It's all about the schedule, and never really flew for me.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Francis Ford Coppola

quotes.Text: Probably the biggest problem I had was I didn't understand the importance of scheduling.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: Anne Donovan

quotes.Text: It takes compromise to raise a child, especially with a schedule like mine.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Future

quotes.Text: I can't live my life according to anyone else's schedule.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Kashmira Shah

quotes.Text: In theater, we know a scheduled season months in advance.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Allison Tolman
